metadata.feature_description: Create new wiki articles with title, content, and metadata, supporting both draft and published states

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test page and click Create article
steps.actual: Create article dialog opened with title, type, content, and tags fields

steps.action: Fill in article details - title: 'Test Article Draft', type: Article, content, tags
Click Publish button to save as draft
steps.expected: Article created and visible in list
steps.actual: Article created successfully, appears in article list
Dialog opened with all required fields

steps.action: Fill in article details - title: 'Published Article Test', content via Redactor API, tags: publish, test
steps.actual: All fields populated, content set via jQuery('#content').dnnRedactor('code.set', ...)

steps.expected: Article published and visible in list
steps.actual: Article published successfully, appears in article list with 'Last updated' timestamp

steps.expected: Dialog opens with required field indicators
steps.actual: Dialog shows asterisks (*) next to Title, Post Type, Content, and Tags labels indicating required fields

steps.action: Attempt to submit form with empty content
steps.actual: Validation error 'Text is required' displayed for content field

steps.action: Fill content and verify validation passes
steps.expected: Form submits successfully after filling required fields
steps.actual: Form submitted successfully when all required fields populated

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create article with special characters in title

steps.action: Create article with title containing special characters: <>&'"@#$%!
steps.expected: Article created successfully with special characters in title
steps.actual: Article created with title 'Test Article with Special Chars: <>&'"@#$%!'

steps.action: Verify article appears in list with special characters
steps.expected: Special characters displayed correctly in article list
steps.actual: Article displayed in list with properly escaped special characters

steps.action: Attempt to create article with existing title 'Test Article Draft'
steps.expected: System prevents duplicate and shows error
steps.actual: Error dialog appeared: 'Unable to publish the changes to your article: An error has occurred'

steps.action: Click Edit button on front page article
steps.expected: Edit dialog opens with current content
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened showing Content field with current article content

steps.action: Modify content via Redactor API and click Publish
steps.actual: Content updated to 'Welcome to the Wiki Test Module! This content was updated via the edit functionality. Edit test successful!'

steps.action: Verify updated content displayed on page
steps.expected: Updated content visible in front page section
steps.actual: Front page article shows updated content with edit confirmation message

steps.action: Click Edit on front page article to access Delete button
steps.expected: Delete button visible in edit dialog
steps.actual: Edit dialog opened with Cancel, Delete, and Publish buttons visible

steps.expected: Article deleted and removed from page
steps.actual: Article deleted successfully, front page section now shows 'Create article for front page...' instead of article content

observations: Article detail page URLs (e.g., /Wiki-Test/Published-Article-Test) return 404 errors even though articles are created and visible in the list. This appears to be a URL routing configuration issue.
The Redactor rich text editor requires special handling - content must be set via jQuery('#content').dnnRedactor('code.set', ...) API rather than direct textarea manipulation for proper data binding.
Copilot welcome dialog appears frequently after page navigation and needs to be dismissed.
Delete button is only available for the primary/front page article when accessed via the Edit dialog. Regular articles would need to be deleted from their detail page, but detail pages return 404.
Code suggests profanity filter functionality exists (FilterContent, ProhibitContent modes in ContentController.cs) but no UI was found to configure or test this feature.
